climbs.name: Bury My Heart At Wounded Knee

content.description:
The eye-catching open book dihedral on the north side of Flowing Springs Road. While it's relatively short, all of the climbing on this rig is quality. A nice handcrack pinches down to fingerlocks and a great stance where you can place 2,3, maybe even 4 5 or 6 pieces of gear before heading into the boulder problem crux.

 Stem and crimp your way through the exciting and slightly dangerous blank section to the enjoyable finish.

 2 bolt rap anchor at the top.

 The name comes from the famous book by Dee Brown
content.protection:
Single Rack BD #.2-#3, very optional #5  

  2 bolt rap anchor
content.location: Park at the west end of the Flowing Springs Rd Campground pullout. You'll see a sign that says 'No Dumping', etc....hike NW past this sign towards the south facing cliff. Contrive a way across the creek which may or may not be several feet deep. The climb is the obvious open book dihedral straight above two large boulders embedded on the north side of the creek. Approach is steep and loose, less than 5 minutes.

climbs.name: Apache Prize Fighter
climbs.fa: Aaron Collins, Manuel Rangel, Joe, and Matt faa mike knarzer

content.description: climb slightly overhanging hand crack making hard moves on good gear to a bolt then maintain your balance to a horizontal shelf  to another bolt, mantle the shelf  to the anchor.
content.location: off the south side Flowing Springs Road

content.description: This area is on both sides of flowing Springs road. Walls are N S and E as the river bends.
